intro: Miconia davidsei, commonly known as the David's miconia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Melastomataceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its large, glossy, ovate leaves and showy, clustered inflorescences of small, pinkish-white flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and private collections.
